column1:
Duq,"2010-08-08T18:52:39.32Z","A very clever model","Just as I had decided to have a go at a Power Functions version of Jennifer Clarks Container truck Lego released this set. I had no choice, I had to buy it...

No numbered bags for this model, just some bags in various sizes with all the parts. The instructions are divided over two books for no apparent reason. I was disappointed to find that the instructions for the B-model are not included.

Building the model isn't especially difficult but there are a few steps where young builders may struggle. You start with the front of the chassis, then work your way back to build the mechanism for tipping or unloading. During the build it's not immediately obvious how it works but it's a very clever trick. The lifting and unloading with the motor works well but the 24t gear in the drive train of the Lineair Actuator should have been a clutch gear to prevent a big rattle when the LA reaches the end of its range.
There are some strange parts choices. I was happy to see the return of the old non-friction pins for some moving parts but in other places friction pins are used for parts that should move. A 10-long studded Technic beams was also a pleasant surprise (it's used for the lights and number plate at the front).

It's a nicely detailed model. The cabin doors open, there are seats, mirrors, lights and the new panels give the cab a nice shape. The blue colour makes a nice change from the mostly red or yellow Technic vehicles. Steering is the traditional Hand of God and unfortunately there was no room for a movinig steering wheel in the cab.

Playability is great with this set, especially if you have the parts to make a second container. The mechanism allows you to collect a full container, tip it somewhere else and deliver it empty again.

All in all a good looking clever model with a nice parts selection. My only criticism is that the PF motor makes it a bit pricey which makes the lack of instructions for the B-model even more frustrating.
",TRUE,4,4,3,5,4

Darrellkenny,"2010-09-19T20:49:02.31Z","A simple designed truck with good to fear functions ","

This is well designed truck with lots of cool parts, great value for money. The instructions are very simple and easy to follow but dont know why they have them in two books!!
The motor is the small one which is a little disappointing cause when you think of a truck it has a big engine so this was a feature that could be better.
The action of the container coming off the back is quite neat but the lever that controls the container tipping up or taking it off is very stiff and requires a bit of
column2: effort, i think it could be better designed and i have played around with making it better.

column1:
Over all you well have fun building it and playing around with it.

",TRUE,4,4,3,3,4

dagny21,"2010-11-12T18:55:03.84Z","Minor complaints, but still a really great set.","I bought this set because it looked fun to build, and I thought my son would enjoy playing with it when I was finished. It took me almost 6 hours to put together (but I think I'm a bit slower than average), and I enjoyed it very much. There wasn't much that gave me trouble, although I did put in the wrong pieces a couple of times due to my own carelessness and had to backtrack.

My son loves playing with this. It holds a nice amount of cargo, he loves the doors, seats, mirrors, and steering wheel. It's very durable for play. He likes the power function, but the terrible noise it makes at either end of the function really bothers him.

  • Pros

  • Very attractive color scheme
  • Pretty easy to build
  • No rubber bands! (I suck at those)
  • Power Function
  • Lots of nice little details, like doors that open and close, seats that move, adjustable mirrors.

  • Cons

  • Quite a few stickers, long skinny ones that are always a challenge to put on so they look nice.
  • Horrible noise made by the power function when it gets to either end.
  • B model instructions not included, you have to download separately.
  • 3 missing tiny pieces in my set, but I had replacements available.
  • The tailgate lock (if that's what it's called) is stupid-looking.
",TRUE,4,4,4,4,4

joao,"2011-02-02T21:14:09.387Z","Dark ages return to LEGO Technic wasn't a good experience","

I always knew I'd return from my dark ages and have been collecting classic LEGO for the last year or so. I loved Technic as a kid but hadn't yet committed to trying one out, mostly because none of the sets appealed to me and because of the new no-studs brick.

I got this one as a gift and it took me two sittings to put it together. The set looks nice once completed but it is a lot of work when compared to a normal studded LEGO. I wouldn't mind if I'd get more than the old wheel-turn mechanism I'd seen when I was a kid and a new screw lift. Almost no gears are present in this set. This set is mostly a display model made of Technic bricks and has very little of mechanic substance which disappointed me.

Because there isn't much to see in it I took it apart and used the numerous pieces for other things.

I'm sticking with stud LEGO for now, but borrowing the motor for some creations.

",TRUE,3,4,1,1,3

I was a suprised to see it functional at the end, the way the gears are positioned during building made me wonder how it will ""tip"" but sure enough.

HarlequinAU,"2011-01-19T01:31:33.653Z","Excellent Intermediary Set","Only gripe I had with this set was the lack of a slip-gear to stop the awful grinding noise when the LA reaches the end of it's travel.

I installed a white 24 tooth clutch (Part No 60c01) to rectify this and now it's perfect.

SenatorBlutarsky,"2011-03-14T16:59:20.743Z","Good, but not great","

As others have indicated, this set will probably never be enshrined in the Technic Hall of Fame, but it certainly
It only took me two and half hours to assemble the A model, including opening the bags and sorting their contents, which is pretty quick for a Technic set with almost 700 parts.
column2: The relatively short build time should probably be an indicator that this is not the most complicated build.&nbsp
column3: Indeed, there are really only two mechanisms in the model:&nbsp
column4: the steering linkage and the tipping/lifting mechanism.

column1: The steering linkage is typical of most Technic models, but the tipping/lifting mechanism is rather unique.
column2: It was not obvious to me during the build process that this mechanism would work as advertised -- there is definitely some subtlety there.&nbsp
column3: The linear actuator raises a rail assembly under the container.&nbsp
column4: This rail assembly is jointed in the middle.&nbsp
column5: For the tipping function, the entire rail assembly is raised, and for the lifting function, just the upper half of the rail assembly pivots.&nbsp
column6: The tipping/lifting selection is made via a lever on the side of the truck chassis.&nbsp
column7: In one position, the lever allows the lower rail assembly to move freely
column8: in the other position, it locks the lower half of the&nbsp
column10: The locking mechanism is where the subtlety lies.&nbsp
column12: There is lever that hangs down from the lower rail assembly.&nbsp
column13: The end of this lever dovetails with another lever assembly that is linked to the selector switch.&nbsp
column14: In one position the the hanging lever is pulled slightly forward, which prevents it from moving upward
column15: in the other position, the hanging lever is pushed slightly backward, which allows it to disengage from the lower chassis lever assembly.

column1: The playability of the main model is good, but it could have been better.
column2: In addition to the steering and tipping/lifting functions, which all work very well, you can also open the cab doors, and lock/unlock the rear tailgate via a small switch at the rear corner of the container.&nbsp
column3: That's not a bad set of functions, but it would have been nice if there were some other function.&nbsp
column4: Also, the container is very shallow, which means that the tailgate is very short.&nbsp
column5: That, in turn, means that only very small items loaded into the container will actually pass through the tailgate when the container is tipped.&nbsp

column1: <li>The set does include some power functions parts -- a battery box, an M motor, and a linear actuator.
<li>The lifting function and the switch to convert from tipping to litfing are somewhat unique, and they both work quite well.

column3: there are probably not nearly as many blue pieces as you might expect, since they are used only for parts of the cab and the rim of the container.

column1: <li>Playability could have been improved by including another function or two -- perhaps&nbsp
column2: a V6 engine or some kind of&nbsp

column1: <li>Some of the details are little goofy looking, like the&nbsp
column2: tailgate lock that other have mentioned.&nbsp
column3: The container looks too shallow as well -- but at least that can be easily fixed by adding a few more rows of beams to the sides.

column1: <li>As others have mentioned, the linear actuator grinds badly at&nbsp
column3: The really annying thing about this problem is that it could easily have been remedied by including a clutch gear in place of the 24T regular gear that sits on the axle that drives the linear actuator.

column1: • There are only 4 gears included (6 if you include the 2 yellow knobs in the steering linkage).
I definitely liked some of the features of this set, including the tipping/lifting mechanism and the blue Technic pieces, but there are also many areas in which it could have been improved.
column3: give it a thumbs up, especially if you are interested getting in the power functions parts.&nbsp

column1: There appears to be a trend to include power functions more and more in the Technic sets.
column2: While I like the power functions, I'm not so sure whether I like this trend.&nbsp
column3: If I continue to acquire sets like this, I am going to end up with a pile of battery boxes that I'll never use.&nbsp
column4:
I almost like the approach taken in sets like the 8053 mobile crane and the 8265 loader better -- don't include power functions parts, but do include instructions for adding power functions parts to the model.

",TRUE,4,4,3,4,3

,TRUE,5,5,5,5,5 Ferrari0806","2021-02-01T09:32:49.51Z","One of the best display sets","

I got this set of a friend. It was never built and mostly sealed. Some of the best features of the set is how power functions can bring the container up and down. I would recommend this set to an experienced builder as parts of this
column2: set can be quite tricky to build. However, once built it is a stunning set. I don&rsquo
column3: t usually play with my sets but watching the beam going up and down is quite fun. Some flaws with this set is that it has a lot of stickers and a lot of empty space that could have been used for more detail. Over all this is one of my favourite sets I own and makes a great display on a shelf.
